body:
OpenActive is an ambitious, community-led initiative for change across the sport and physical activity sector, which promotes the use of opportunity data to help people get active.

Our goal is to make data on what, where and when physical activity sessions happen, openly available. This “opportunity data” includes details of a yoga class (“how much will it cost?”) through to badminton court availability (“where and when is a court available?”). 

This interactive tutorial shows you how to create "opportunity data" that conforms to the community developed opportunity modelling specification.

For publishers and activity providers this tutorial will help get your data out there!

For users this tutorial will help you understand what sort of data you can use in your applications.

 

Each lesson should between 10-20 minutes to complete and it is highly recommended you follow the lessons in order.

 


Click on lesson 1 to get started creating your opportunity data!
title: Open Active -  Creating opportunity data
